'Transition temperature' is the temperature at which a material changes from one
crystal state (allotrope) to another. For example, when rhombic sulfur is heated
above 96Â°C it changes form into monoclinic sulfur. When cooled below 96Â°C it
reverts to rhombic sulfur.

In the case of ferroelectric or ferromagnetic crystals a transition temperature
may be known as the Curie temperature.
